fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29407].
  {panel}

Please see attached screenshot.

When looking at an issue, the following columns are shown for sub-tasks:
Number | Summary | Issue Type Icon | Status Icon | Status Text | Assignee

but for linked issues the following columns are shown:
Link Type | Issue Type Icon | Issue Key | Summary | Priority Icon | Status Icon

Especially the missing 'Status Text' for linked issues is giving us a lot of trouble, because it is difficult to assess the status of e.g. blocking issues. We believe this should be homogenized because sub-tasks are also just (internally) linked issues.

If there is a way of customizing the behavior through the configuration, please point me to it. I still believe it is a valid improvement request and the current behavior needs to be changed.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show the same information for linked issues and subtasks (e.g. status text, issue key)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29406].
  {panel}

Since we are heavily relying on linking between issues I would like to raise a feature request for the following two use cases:

(1) We would like to define contexts or schemes that allow us to restrict link types to certain subsets of projects, because right now we have set up a lot of link types that do not make sense for all of the projects we have.

(2) Internal link types / hiding of link types from users even though they are valid for the current project. This would be very useful for us because we are automatically linking tickets using special "internal" link types that were raised from other projects (e.g. L1 / L2 / QA / etc.). If a user can edit / create these manually, it can break our whole link structure. Basically we want to do the same JIRA does with it's internal subtask link that users cannot manually edit.

(3) Advanced permissions on who can use a certain link type. This is particularly useful when removing link types that e.g. identify blockers for a certain issue.
fields.summary: Link Type Context / Internal Link Type / Advanced Linking Permissions

fields.description:
If you obtain an Options object and use one of its mutating operations, such as addOption or removeOption, its underlying list is not updated accordingly.  Perhaps this is in some way desirable as a casual attempt to making this object immutable?  In any case, it causes several problems.
* Options extends List, so nothing really stops you from mutating the underlying list directly.
* Multiple mutating operations produce strange results.  For example, if you call addOption twice, both options will get the same sequence number, because it's taken from the current size of the collection and that doesn't get updated.  Similarly, adding an option and then calling getRootOptions() will produce the original instead of updated state.
* This is undocumented and extremely surprising behaviour.

Workaround:
* Work with the OptionsManager directly
* Obtain a new Options after every mutating call
fields.summary: OptionsImpl does not update its internal state when used to modify option lists

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29403].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a privilege escalation vulnerabilities that affect JIRA instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers). This vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass authentication and authorisation controls by hitting specially crafted URLs. The attacker does not need to have an account on the affected JIRA server. The attacker will be able to execute a large number of administrative actions.

This vulnerability has been fixed in JIRA 5.0.7 and later. Patches are available for JIRA 4.3.4, 4.4.5 and 5.0.6.

Full details are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-08-28

*Note:* the patch instructions files refer to JRA-29138, please ignore this, they are indeed the correct instructions.
*Note 2:* If you encounter error messages after applying the patch, see if [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/getLinksForSection+error+at+the+top+of+the+page] applies
fields.summary: Privilege escalation vulnerability
Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29401].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a cross-site request forgery (XSRF) vulnerability that affects JIRA instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers).

The XSRF vulnerability relates to commenting on issues. An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to make other users to post issue comments of his choice.

You can read more about XSRF attacks at http://www.cgisecurity.com/csrf-faq.html and other places on the web.

This vulnerability affects JIRA 4.2 and above, and has been fixed in JIRA 5.1

More information is available in the advisory at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-08-28
fields.summary: Cross-Site Request Forgery vulnerability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29400].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed 2 open redirect vulnerabilities that affect JIRA instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers).

Parameter-based redirection vulnerabilities allow an attacker to craft a JIRA URL in such a way that a user clicking on this URL will be redirected to a different web site. This can be used for phishing.

These vulnerabilities affect JIRA 4.3.3 and above, and have been fixed in JIRA 5.1.1.

More information is available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-08-28
fields.summary: Open Redirect vulnerabilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29397].
  {panel}

Copied to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2137

The Activity Stream gadget does not render the images as it does not include the base url of Confluence. Since it does not have the base url prepended, the links are broken and images aren't rendered (it tries to resolve the image with the JIRA base url).
The following was the test (replicated locally with 5.1.1 JIRA and Confluence 4.2.11).
* Confluence and JIRA in two different machines
* Confluence using JIRA for user management (appears with different user management also)
* Activity stream gadget added to JIRA dashboard
* The images that are added to Confluence without resizing works correctly.
* The images which are resized in Confluence fails to show up in the Activity stream gadget (it does not have a base url prepended and it breaks).
* The same error happens for gallery too.
fields.summary: Confluence Images Not Displayed in JIRA activity Stream

Please investigate this issue and fix it if it's really a bug.

Regards,
Daisuke Niwa

fields.description:
We have discovered a plugin reloadability problems in and around the SimpleLinkFactory code.

Its seems it related to the case where UPM is self updated.  After this the 
DefaultSimpleLinkFactory and its underlying DefaultPluginModuleTracker plugins code seems to hold onto a reference to the unloaded GH instance and does not contain a reference to the new instance.

I hypothesize that it does not get the right "plugin event" and hence misses the opportunity to update itself and therefore has stale data.

{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-08-17 11:15:14,325 http-2990-6 ERROR admin 675x2100x1 1a03cus 127.0.0.1 /rest/api/1.0/menus/greenhopper_menu [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.NullPointerException
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl.getI18n(I18nFactoryServiceImpl.java:84)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl.getI18n(I18nFactoryServiceImpl.java:61)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.navigation.RapidViewHistoryLinkFactory.getLinks(RapidViewHistoryLinkFactory.java:56)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinks(DefaultSimpleLinkManager.java:161)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinksForSection(DefaultSimpleLinkManager.java:124)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor282.invoke(Unknown Source)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.multitenant.impl.MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl$AbstractMultiTenantAwareInvocationHandler.invokeInternal(MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl.java:181)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.multitenant.impl.MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl$MultiTenantAwareInvocationHandler.invoke(MultiTenantComponentFactoryImpl.java:211)
{code}


To reproduce do the following

* Have JIRA 5.1.2 up with GH installed
* The Agile menu should have a drop down of all available boards

* In another tab goto plugin manager and "install plugin" a new version of UPM
* Say https://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/upm/atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin/2.4.1/atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-2.4.1.jar

* Then go to the other tab and drop the GH Agile menu.  
* The call will fail and result in an exception on the server and a red error message for the user.

(Try this a couple of times if you dont replicate.  There seems to be some timing involved but not a lot since I was able to do it 3 times out of 4.)


The problem is that because the "old implementation" is cached, it stays broken until JIRa restarts.

The NullPointerException you see above is because the GH code that it is calling has already been torn down and hence goes pop when called.

I think this is a UPM related thing because if I plugin reload GH then it all works as expected.  I think its the UPM self update that is causing this problem.

For the record GH has an optional dependency on UPM. (Licencing).  When UPM goes down, then so does GH because of this now wired dep.  GH comes back up once UPM is back up but the damage is donw and the internal JIRA SimpleLinkFactory cache is not cleared properly.

This issue is the cause of GHS-5633.  

I think with the "increased propensity" for people to auto upgarde UPM, this is going to cause us a future support headache.
fields.summary: DefaultSimpleLinkManager has a plugin reloadability issue

I have a javascript in a hidden field on a create issue screen for a project. The script hides certain fields and assigns values to other fields based on the user's entries on the create issue screen.

When I instatiate the create issue screen for this project/issue type combination, the script fires and the screen displays the correct fields. I don't enter any data on the screen but then select another project/issue type. Again, without entering any data I select the first project/issue type that has the javascript which causes the create issue screen to refresh. This time, the javascript does not fire and the create issue screen displays all of the fields that should be hidden or manipulated by the javascript.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29381].
  {panel}

The Two Dimensional Gadget has a field named "Number of Results" with a default value of 5 and description text "Number of results to display." The problem is that people don't know what this means - X? Y? Does it affect the load on JIRA?

A better description text would be:

"Number of rows to display, use 0 to display all rows."

I updated https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Two-Dimensional+Filter+Statistics+Gadget with this information already.
fields.summary: A better description for the Number of Results parameter
Option to store attachments in the database

fields.description:
A server starts with time set to 20:00

JIRA starts and JIRA services run, time of last recorded run time is 20:01 for example

Then ntp runs on the server, the time is now corrected to 10:00

ServiceRunner runs and checks "is the last run time plus a delay in my past? 
If so, run the service"

But because the last run time is in the future the service will not get run until the server's time catches up to where it was when the last run time was set.

If the time alteration is small then this isn't noticed. If you change the time by 10 hours then all the services such as backup and sending email won't execute for another 10 hours.
fields.summary: Changing a server's time stops services running

fields.description:
During the transition process, if users change the assignee field and forgot to input a value into any required fields JIRA will reject the submission. However, the assignee selection is lost and it revert back to the previous assignee.

*How To Reproduce The Issue*

# Create a fresh JIRA installation
# Made *Log Work* field as "Required"
# Create a new issue assigned to default assignee
# Click "Resolve Issue"
# Assigneed it to other users
# Keep "Time Spent" field empty
# Click "Resolve" Button
# JIRA will reject the submission and assignee value is back to the default assignee
#* In JIRA 5.1.2, the assignee field content the username (not the user)
#* After submission, JIRA will assign it back to default assignee
fields.summary: Assignee Selection is Lost When a Required Field Left Empty

  {panel}

At https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.13.5+Release+Notes
the list of issues fixed in that release no longer appears as it used to.

Instead there is an error:

Error rendering macro 'jiraissues' : JIRA project does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.
fields.summary: The list of issues in old release notes is broken

fields.description:
After disabled the autocomplete feature for the assignee field by modifying file {{jira-features.properties}} and setting the "frother.assignee.field = false" by following the guide from JIRA document [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fully+render+assignee+drop-down+list], the "Assign to me" button doesn't work in the following situation. This affecting the JIRA version 5.0.2, 5.0.6 and also the latest JIRA 5.1. (May also affect other versions as well)

*Steps to reproduce the problem*:
# disabled the autocomplete feature for the assignee field by modifying file {{jira-features.properties}}:
{noformat}
frother.assignee.field = false
{noformat}
# Create a project and configure the project leader to a user with no Assignable Users permission.
# During issue creation, chose "Custom" from the "Configuration Fields", if the "Assignee" field is checked. Please see the following attachment 
!step 2.PNG|thumbnail!,
# Uncheck the "Assignee", see !setp 3.PNG|thumbnail!
# Create issue, then will see the error message in red color, this is reasonable since the project leader is not assignable and the "Automatic" option assign issue to project leader.
!step 4.PNG|thumbnail!
# Click on "Assign to Me" button

*The problem* when click "Assign To Me" button, the assignee field will not be changed, and still showing "Automatic".*

Note: in step 2, the assignee field must be checked.
fields.summary: "Assign to me" button does not work when uncheck the "Assignee"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29373].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Description
*It's only applicable to OnDemand instance*
If you add user from Administration, and put blank on password field, it mentioned _If you do not enter a password, one will be generated automatically._ and if you check Send notification Email, it displayed _Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password (if applicable)._. The user will receive email notification, and there's a _Set my password_ button, and it's directed to User profile which requires user password that they don't have.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to _Administration >> User Management >> Users_
# Click *Create User* button
# Leave the password blank and put the username and email
# Check Send Notification Email
# Upon receiving the notification, the button redirected to User profile that redirected to User profile.

h4. Workaround
You could click _Request New Password_ instead to reset your password
fields.summary: Adding user without specifying password redirect to user profile that required password

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29371].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

It would be useful to be able to configure which fields is shown and which is not shown according to which workflow step it is transitioning into.

An example of how this would work :

* Have a screen with 10 fields
* Configure it so that 5 fields will appear when transitioning to step 2, and the other 5 will be shown in step 3

  {panel}

When viewing a version in the roadmap view sub tasks are not nested under their parent tasks in a local manner. This completely eliminates any possibility of easy observing relationship between issues at a glance.

Proper lay out would increase usability greatly. 

Example of a more usable layout:


Sorted by Key but nesting sub tasks then sorting them by key under their parents:

VERSION 1
[Task 1]
   [Sub-task 1]
   [Sub-Task 2]
[Task 2]
   [Sub-Task 3]
[Task 3]
[Task 4]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29359].
  {panel}

I'd like the ability to set the Time Tracking to display in hh: mm: ss

The current available options are: (e.g. 4 days, 4 hours, 30 minutes), days (e.g. 4d 4.5h) or hours (e.g. 36.5h).
Which ends up showing as the following:

!screenshot-1.jpg|thumbnail!

Due to the configurations it can also happen the following:

!TimeTrackingJira2.png|thumbnail!

This makes the time tracking hard to understand once it follows the rule below:

||Minute ||Hour ||
|51 |0.85 |
|53|0.88333...|

E.g.: Logging 51m Jira will break to 0.85h due to the Time Tracking settings, to log 53m Jira would have to break the value to 0.88333...
fields.summary: Time Tracking Configuration

fields.description:
In JIRA 5.1.1, if you make the following steps:

# Create an empty Screen.
# Add it to a Screen Scheme and map it to an Issue Operation (e.g. Edit Issue)
# Associate that Screen Scheme with a Project.
# Create a ticket and try to Edit it.

The result is that your browser hangs while you do not get a relevant message in the logs.

Resolution is to add at least one field in that screen.

Can we please check
# Why does the browser hang?
# How we can add an informative message in the logs instead of having the browser loading indefinitely?

We have reproduced and created [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Browser+Hangs+when+initiating+an+Issue+Operation] about this.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Browser hangs when a screen is empty with no appropriate message in the logs

  {panel}

*Reproduction Steps*

# Add a comment to a JIRA issue
# Set the comment security level to be restricted to the "Administrators" role
# In the comment content, mention users who only have "Users" role
# Submit the comment
# *Bug* The comment content will be sent via an email mentions notification to the mentioned users.

JIRA should not send mention notifications to users who do not match the security level set for the comment.

fields.description:
If the jira.projectkey.pattern is set to "((\[A-Z0-9\]\{0,5\}-)?(\[0-9\]\{4\}))\{1\}", when adding the "issue key" in the the comment, it will return an output "project key""issue key". 

For example, if my project key is TEST-1234 and the issue key is TEST-1234-01. So, once the issue key is added in the comment it show up the text message "TEST-1234TEST-1234-01" as in the screen shot.

Here is the steps to reproduce the issue: 

# Create a normal user only belong to the jira-users group.

# Login with the new user then go to the project administration page.
# Try to remove users or group from a project role that has been granted the Administer Project permission from your permission scheme, and the error message will show up:

You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role.

fields.description:
h3. Symptom

After upgrading from the bundled version (5.0.4.1) to 5.2.1, the activity module shows an error instead of comments, history, etc. (see attached screenshot).

The following will be seen within {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}
Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:activitymodule'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.
{noformat}

OR
{code}
2012-08-14 20:23:59,764 http-8080-2 ERROR xrc 1223x2059x3 1zvltu 167.3.8.113,127.0.0.1 /browse/JSP-444 [jira.web.component.ModuleWebComponentImpl] Error rendering web panel: com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:activitymodule (null)
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/applinks/api/application/stash/StashApplicationType
	at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.stash.StashCommitServiceImpl.isConfigured(StashCommitServiceImpl.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.web.ShowPanelHelperImpl.isAssociatedWith(ShowPanelHelperImpl.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.web.ShowPanelHelperImpl.showIssuePanel(ShowPanelHelperImpl.java:59)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Disabling the plugin or downgrading it (i.e. removing it from {{<JIRA HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins}} and restart JIRA) is a workaround to get comments back.

h3. Bug Replication

* install a blank JIRA 5.1.2 instance (also tested with JIRA 5.0.7),
* create a sample project and issue (noticing that there is not error in the * activity module on the 'View Issue' page),
* go to the UPM and upgrade the FishEye plugin to 5.2.1
* view the sample issue again.

(i) This is being tracked in [FISH-578|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-578].
fields.summary: Comments not viewable in JIRA after upgrade to FishEye plugin 5.2.1

fields.description:
Hello team,

We have discovered that if we map the "Issue Key" JIRA field from a CSV file will properly create the issue, but will cause the failure when trying to import the attachments.

If we change the mapping of the CSV value to other field, the problem won't happen and attachments get attached without any issues.

Basically, seems that when the mapping is changed to issue key, attachments fail to get attached.

Could you please look into this?
Thanks in advance!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29335].
  {panel}

Emails from a server will use JIRA or Local timezones (semi unpredictably), never user configured timezones. 

Steps to reproduce:

# Configure your user to use non JIRA default timezones. In my test I used America - GMT -8 Los Angelas.
# Configure JIRA to auto detect system time.
# Enable notify me on my changes in the user profile
# Enable email notifications on a project
# Configure an outbound email server
# Create an issue, and verify that the time in the email is correct.
# Shut down the instance.
# Change the timezone on instance host. In my case, I used GMT-6 Chicago.
# Bring the instance back online.
# Create an issue and see the time. Time will be matched to LOCAL AND JIRA.  *IGNORES USER SETTING*
# Change JIRA to use GMT-8 Los Angelas.
# Create an issue and see the email. Time will be matched to JIRA. *IGNORES LOCAL TIME AND USER TIME, ONLY VIEWS JIRA TIME*
# Change JIRA time to GMT -6 Chicago.
# Shut down JIRA.
# Change local time to GMT -8.
# Start JIRA.
# Create an issue. Time will be matched to LOCAL. *IGNORES JIRA TIME AND USER TIME, ONLY VIEWS LOCAL TIME*
fields.summary: Time in email ignores user set timezone and other shenanigans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29334].
  {panel}

We are missing the option to share filters to all existing groups even if you are not member of this group. This option is especially important as it controls which rapid boards are visible to users too. 
For sure this need to be controlled by a special right and not everybody should have this option by default. Also I would vote for restricting the share with everybody option with the same right.

Use Cases:
* PO would like to share a filter with a team
* employee would like to share a filter to a management group

I would like to split it up on 3 different right levels:
1) no share permission at all (exists right now)
2) share to groups/projects where user is a member 
3) share to all existing groups + share with everybody
fields.summary: option to share filters to all existing groups

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 11 November 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

Thanks for your votes and feedback on this bug report. 

We are happy to announce that this work has already been completed and that the issue has been resolved for JIRA 6.3.10 and later versions. 

Customers using the workaround to disable inline edit are encouraged to enable this feature again for an improved user experience after upgrading.

Thanks a lot for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to bug reports and suggestions.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández.
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].
{panel} 

h4. Summary
When the user edits the Assignee using the Edit screen or the new Inline Editing feature, it triggers an Issue Updated event.

It would be better to trigger the Issue Assigned event whenever the Assignee is changed, no matter how it was changed.

h4. Workarounds
- Disable In-line editing for Assignee field - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Disable+Inline+Edit+for+Assignee+Field
- Use the 'Issue Updated' event for notifications, as that event is triggered instead.
fields.summary: Editing Assignee should trigger 'Issue Assigned' event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29327].
  {panel}

There are plenty of Version events:

* VersionArchiveEvent
* VersionCreateEvent
* VersionDeleteEvent
* VersionMergeEvent
* VersionMoveEvent
* VersionReleaseEvent
* VersionUnarchiveEvent
* VersionUnreleaseEvent

However, one seems to be missing: {{VersionUpdateEvent}}.

My use-case for this is that I'm writing a plugin that has to keep an external system informed about when a bug is scheduled for release. 

While I have written an event listener for when a version is added/removed for the _Fix for_ field, this does not cover the situation when an existing version is rescheduled. Therefore, I need to be able to listen for {{VersionUpdateEvent}}.
fields.summary: Add support for VersionUpdateEvent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29325].
  {panel}

In every non-US environment one of the first things an admin does is adjust the software to the current locale. This usually involves choosing language, decimal separator and date/time formats, if not recognized automatically.

Currently, NLS settings exist in two places (afaik):
- System -> User interface -> Section "Design", below the colors
- System -> General configuration -> Extended ... (Button on bottom)

My suggestions are:

1. Have all NLS settings at *one* place and have a separate section or menu entry "NLS settings" or such. Do not hide them away.

2. Make it explicit what each NLS setting affects. There is some nice description for the four Java/JavaScript date/time settings available, but there is no comment on what the date/time settings in the Design section are supposed to affect or not affect. There's also no hint how the date/time settings in the Design settings complement or interfer with the field date/time settings.

3. Things would imho be much more comfortable if JIRA came with a few widely used presets for NLS settings, such as
  - US format, numbers only: 12/31/1999 5:32 PM
  - US format, abbrev. months: Dec/31/1999 5:32 PM
  - European format: 31.12.1999 17:32
  - ISO standard format: 1999-12-31 17:32
  - maybe one or two others...
  (There are web pages listing the world's most common date/time formats.)
This would avoid the need to study the format descriptions first and play with the Java/JavaScript date/time setting, thus reducing the chance of errors.

4. It is currently not clear for me as an admin whether NLS settings are JIRA-wide for *any* user or whether they depend on the locale setting of each user's PC, which might vary. Ideally translations, date/time formats and such would automatically adjust to the defaults of each user's locale, with no need for the admin to specify *any* explicit format.
See also issue JRA-10613 (Time and date formats should be depending on users profile) for this.

I hope these suggestions will help improve JIRA. Feel free to split them into separate issues if you like.
fields.summary: Improve NLS and date/time format configuration in JIRA

fields.description: The WF designer saves each change to JIRA by making a request (moving graph elements, editing a transition etc). After the JRA-28369 fix the WF designer refreshes the whole page when the session has expired. It means that the last action is lost. E.g., if you go edit the transition, enter the data in the dialog and press Save the page will be refreshed and the data will be lost. In case this turns out to be a significant problem for customers we should consider changing the behaviour in order to avoid the loss.

h3. Summary

As of JIRA 5.1.2, each time the user changes a field configuration context (e.g. add a project to a context) it can take minutes to display the dashboard with some filter gadgets on it, or load other requests that access the cache. The bar on the gadget just keeps spinning. The field that has been changed before switching to the dashboard was not related to any of the fields known to the projects defined in the gadget filters.

This behaviour continues until the original thread finishes completing the cache population, then the other threads can complete as the cache is then loaded into memory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29307].
  {panel}

When adding custom fields they can only be restricted to certain projects but there is no way to make them available for a scheme. Manually choosing the projects a custom field applies to is not a good way because it is very error-prone (think about what happens when the customer adds projects at a later stage). Therefore most people end up using the global context but restricting the field to certain field configurations. However, the field is automatically added to all field configurations and per default SHOWN. This means you have to go through every single field configuration and HIDE it.

I can think of two possible solutions:

(1) Implement Custom Field Schemes

OR

(2) Implement another wizard page when adding a new custom field that allows to show / hide the custom field for certain field configurations (just like it is done with Screens)

fields.description:
GreenHopper code is littered with usage of ChangeHistory#getChangeItems() directly inside loop statements (i.e. without null check). When JIRA data is in a certain state as a result of being from a very old version of JIRA (e.g. on JAC), this call can lead to null being returned instead of an empty list.

We should safeguard against this in JIRA so that consumers of the API are not adversely affected. We should also mention this in the Javadoc.

Additionally, it would be nice if the ChangeHistory class was actually an interface.

(Discovered as part of bug GHS-5394)
fields.summary: ChangeHistory#getChangeItems() can return null and is unsafe
Incorrect upgrade docs - 4.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29295].
  {panel}

I noticed that JIRA.Mention is now using Backbone.js and the old implementation is available as JIRA.LegacyMention

That is great but I had extended the old implementation to provide alternative REST endpoint (/user/search instead of /user/viewissue/search). This breaks in JIRA 5.1.2

It would be ideal that the JIRA.Mention would just accept options to either use custom endpoint and/or simply use /user/search when projectKey is not provided. That way I could use JIRA.Mention without hacking to get it to work with non-project specific mentioning.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Make JIRA.Mention controller accept optional REST URL to enable re-use
